etymology.description: 並(並) (bìng, "together") + phonetic: 用(用) (yòng, "use") = spreading together wide and far -> universal
etymology.interpretation: The character 普(pǔ, "universal") combines 並(bìng, "together") suggesting things aligned uniformly, with 用(yòng, "use") indicating an action applied broadly. This evokes the sense of something applied or spread universally.

examples.chinese: 真理普照人间(真理普照人間)。
古代先贤提倡普及教育(古代先賢提倡普及教育)。
日新月异推动科技进步(日新月異推動科技進步)，普及知识改变生活(普及知識改變生活)。
examples.pinyin: Rìxīn yuèyì tuīdòng kējì jìnbù, pǔjí zhīshi gǎibiàn shēnghuó.
examples.english: Rapid changes propel technological progress, and the universal spread of knowledge transforms lives.
